markdown:
<title level="1" right="Spell 8" pfs="Standard">
[Punishing Winds](/Spells.aspx?ID=1643)
<actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Air" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=5" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 351 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Tradition**
[Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deity**
[Breath Of The Endless Sky](/Deities.aspx?ID=366)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 100 feet

**Area** 30-foot radius, 100-foot-tall cylinder

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Violent winds and a powerful downdraft fill the area, forming a cyclone. All flying creatures in the area descend 40 feet. The entire area is [greater difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) for [Flying](/Actions.aspx?ID=94) creatures, and difficult terrain for creatures on the ground or [Climbing](/Actions.aspx?ID=33). Any creature that ends its turn Flying within the area descends 20 feet. Any creature pushed into a surface by this spell's winds takes bludgeoning damage as though it had fallen.

 The squares at the outside vertical edges of the cylinder prevent creatures from leaving. These squares are greater difficult terrain, and a creature attempting to push through must succeed at an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check or [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) check to [Maneuver in Flight](/Actions.aspx?ID=30) against your spell DC to get through. A creature that fails ends its current action but can try again.
name: Punishing Winds

summary: A cyclone inhibits flight and traps creatures.
summary_markdown: A cyclone inhibits flight and traps creatures.
text: Punishing Winds Three Actions Source Player Core pg. 351 2.0 Tradition Primal Deity Breath Of The Endless Sky Range 100 feet Area 30-foot radius, 100-foot-tall cylinder Duration sustained up to 1 minute --- Violent winds and a powerful downdraft fill the area, forming a cyclone. All flying creatures in the area descend 40 feet. The entire area is greater difficult terrain for Flying creatures, and difficult terrain for creatures on the ground or Climbing. Any creature that ends its turn Flying within the area descends 20 feet. Any creature pushed into a surface by this spell's winds takes bludgeoning damage as though it had fallen. The squares at the outside vertical edges of the cylinder prevent creatures from leaving. These squares are greater difficult terrain, and a creature attempting to push through must succeed at an Athletics check or Acrobatics check to Maneuver in Flight against your spell DC to get through. A creature that fails ends its current action but can try again.
